newsitem.title: USA: Republican group offers U.S. budget plan.
newsitem.headline: Republican group offers U.S. budget plan.

text.p: Sen. Phil Gramm and several other House and Senate Republicans said Thursday the budget could be balanced in five years if entitlement programs were cut $81 billion across the board over five years.

The Republicans offered a five-point balanced budget proposal which would also freeze domestic spending at the lower fiscal 1997 level for five years and rein in the the Medicare health care program by $100 billion through 2002.
Their proposal would also implement $17 billion of asset sales called for by Clinton and enact his $98 billion tax cut.
